meanings.definition: Absence or failure of development of a body part or organ.
meanings.sent1: The agenesis of his arm made it difficult for him to play the piano.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the agenesis of her kidney at birth.
meanings.sent3: The agenesis of the tree's leaves in winter made it look like a giant stick figure.
meanings.sent4: Her agenesis of creativity was like a barren desert in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The agenesis of the bridge's support beams caused it to collapse in the storm.

meanings.definition: Congenital absence of an organ or body part.
meanings.sent1: The baby's agenesis of a finger did not hinder his ability to grasp objects.
meanings.sent2: The genetic condition caused agenesis of the heart in the fetus.
meanings.sent3: The agenesis of the clown's nose made him the least funny in the circus.
meanings.sent4: Her agenesis of trust left her feeling isolated and alone.
meanings.sent5: The agenesis of the flower's petals gave it a unique and striking appearance.

meanings.definition: Failure of an organ or body part to develop.
meanings.sent1: The agenesis of her teeth caused eating difficulties from a young age.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the agenesis of his lungs as a rare medical condition.
meanings.sent3: The agenesis of the student's homework was a surprise to the teacher.
meanings.sent4: His agenesis of ambition held him back from reaching his full potential.
meanings.sent5: The agenesis of the city's infrastructure led to chaos during the storm.
